job_title: Student Software Developer Fall Co-op (Tech Start-up/ Social Health)
listing_jobDesc: About UsLaunching in the Summer of 2022, Goodself is on a mission to help people find and deliver relevant, trustworthy Health, Wellness, and Lifestyle information through a first-of-its-kind free social media app platform exclusively around Health, Wellness and Lifestyle. We are building an engaged community of Users that want to get better and can see others like them getting better, along with access to credible information through vetted Experts, across a variety of health topics. Please visit us at joingoodself.com for more information.Student Software Developer Fall Co-op(Tech Start-up/Social Health) Job Description: We are looking for a student currently enrolled in a STEM program to take part in a fall co-op/internship here at Goodself - a health/tech social media platform. The role would focus primarily on mobile app development using React Native, and various research responsibilities.Responsibilities would include: Reviewing and understanding business requirements, functional and technical specifications, and programming accordingly.Utilizing various system utilities, networking, and verification tools to diagnose and enhance system performance.Ensuring all code is written, tested, and integrated with the rest of the project codebase and version control system.Helping with troubleshooting operational data issues.Researching industry trends and best practices and recommending which approaches will benefit the company.Suggesting enhancements to software where applicable.Participating in technical design discussions, demos, and daily stand-ups.Preference to candidates who are: Currently enrolled in a computer science or computer engineering program.Experienced with React Native mobile application development.Have project experience in developing software in a team environment and strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Experience with multiple development languages is an asset.Experience developing websites/mobile applications is an asset.Proven ability to multi-task and work towards meeting pre-defined timelines, delivering quality work*Only applications through indeed will be considered.*Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20-30 per weekSalary: From $16.00 per hourBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication question(s):Do you have any start-up experience?Do you have experience with React Native?What are your wage expectations?Expected start date: 2022-09-01 About UsLaunching in the Summer of 2022, Goodself is on a mission to help people find and deliver relevant, trustworthy Health, Wellness, and Lifestyle information through a first-of-its-kind free social media app platform exclusively around Health, Wellness and Lifestyle. We are building an engaged community of Users that want to get better and can see others like them getting better, along with access to credible information through vetted Experts, across a variety of health topics. Please visit us at joingoodself.com for more information.Student Software Developer Fall Co-op(Tech Start-up/Social Health) Job Description: We are looking for a student currently enrolled in a STEM program to take part in a fall co-op/internship here at Goodself - a health/tech social media platform. The role would focus primarily on mobile app development using React Native, and various research responsibilities.Responsibilities would include: Reviewing and understanding business requirements, functional and technical specifications, and programming accordingly.Utilizing various system utilities, networking, and verification tools to diagnose and enhance system performance.Ensuring all code is written, tested, and integrated with the rest of the project codebase and version control system.Helping with troubleshooting operational data issues.Researching industry trends and best practices and recommending which approaches will benefit the company.Suggesting enhancements to software where applicable.Participating in technical design discussions, demos, and daily stand-ups.Preference to candidates who are: Currently enrolled in a computer science or computer engineering program.Experienced with React Native mobile application development.Have project experience in developing software in a team environment and strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.Experience with multiple development languages is an asset.Experience developing websites/mobile applications is an asset.Proven ability to multi-task and work towards meeting pre-defined timelines, delivering quality work*Only applications through indeed will be considered.*Job Types: Part-time, Fixed term contract, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20-30 per weekSalary: From $16.00 per hourBenefits:Work from homeSchedule:Monday to FridayApplication question(s):Do you have any start-up experience?Do you have experience with React Native?What are your wage expectations?Expected start date: 2022-09-01 Show more

Location:
Calgary, AB
Job Type:
Intermediate
Education Level:
Diploma or Degree in a Computer-Science or a related discipline or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Number of Positions:
1
Job Reference:
MQJOB-2105-0331-2021
Position Overview
MQ is seeking a Full-Time Mobile Developer who is passionate about building and creating performant mobile apps on iOS and Android platforms and can work collaboratively with our talented team to help create custom mobile solutions and be at the forefront of helping our clients lead in their industry by using digital solutions to solve complex challenges.
Qualifications
The candidates we are searching for should display extensive knowledge and experience with:
Objective C/Swift
Java/Kotlin
HTML, CSS, JavaScript and TypeScript (ES6) (JSX)
XCode, Android Studio, VS Code and/or JetBrains Suite of Products
Google Play Store/Apple App Store and their mobile testing and deployment processes
Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, and emerging technologies
OOP design principles
RESTful API creation and integration
Solid understanding of the mobile development life cycle from end to end
Roles and Responsibilities:
Work collaboratively with our team of project leads, designers, and developers to build a variety of industry-leading mobile apps.
Ability to self-manage projects with attention to detail, deadlines and shifting priorities.
Participate in daily code reviews and perform extensive testing to ensure code meets expected quality.
Provide ongoing maintenance, upgrades, support and enhancements to existing client applications.
Remain current with the developments, terminology, concepts and best practices for the development of mobile applications.
Technical Requirements:
Minimum of 3+ years of demonstrable experience
Fundamental knowledge of core mobile principles (UI implementation, iOS and/or Android application development frameworks, Restful APIs)
Basic understanding of iOS app deployment procedures. (Store deployment, Enterprise deployment, certificates, provisioning profiles)
Prior experience with Cross-Platform Mobile Frameworks (React Native, Ionic and/or Flutter) is an asset
Experience with third-party libraries and consuming APIs within the mobile ecosystem
Ability and flexibility to perform in a team environment
Excellent analytical skills with an excellent problem-solving attitude
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to interpret and follow technical plans
Experience with distributed version control systems and associated tools
Prior experience with push messaging technologies in Android (GCM/FCM) and iOS (APNS); preference will be given to candidates with experience in both
Strong testing, diagnosing and debugging skills
Experience with offline/online device storage and retrieval
Apply Today
Applications for this position must be submitted to careers@mobilityquotient.com with the subject line 'Mobile App Developer Application' Location:
Calgary, AB
Job Type:
Intermediate
Education Level:

Calgary, Canada
Job Description

Who we are:
Competing in a data-driven world, most businesses struggle to capture real value from data and analytics. Data management constraints cause mid-size and large companies to miss key opportunities in the value chain. Companies are left vulnerable to underwhelming performance and encroachment by competitors.
A4 Systems is a world-class team of cyber physical system product developers, transforming quality data into primary competitive advantage. A trusted partner to industries like manufacturing, agriculture, and energy, A4 builds mission-critical SaaS products for customers to achieve breakthrough performance.
What you’ll be doing:
Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release and support)
Write unit and UI tests to identify malfunctions
Identify opportunities to develop new mobile products and protocols
Develop APIs to support functionality of mobile devices
Adapt current web applications for mobile platforms
Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance
Design interfaces to improve user experience
Work with Product development team
Identify and plan for new features
Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards
Suggest and implement new mobile products, applications and protocols
Who you are:
Previous working experience as a Mobile developer for (3) years
Min. 3 years of experience with system design, programming, and data structuring
Min. 3 years experience with third-party libraries and APIs
Experience programming in C++ and Java
Experience with OOP design principles
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to distill complex technical plans into easily understandable concepts for executive reports
Rich portfolio of released applications for the Android market

Salary Range: $65,900 - $100,700

Problem Solving
Passion for technology
Ability to learn
Communication
Teamwork
Must Have
Excellent organization, planning and time management skills
Capable of adapting quickly, manage multiple demands and competing priorities, deliver to deadlines
Critical thinking
Strong problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams
A desire to learn and grow professionally and personally
Energy- contributing to a positive work environment
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Core Values
Authentic
Accountable
Approachable
Avid Learner
Culture
Team building lunches every week
Team building activities and company events
Personal and professional development
Open door policy
Casual dress code
What's great in the job?

The opportunity to work with a diverse group of like minded individuals who believe in the sharing of knowledge
A management team that is hands-on with the projects
An open door policy that enables that sharing of ideas
A project based corporation where no two days are the same
What We Offer

Each employee has a chance to see the impact of his work. You can make a real contribution to the success of the company.
Creative Work Environment
Professional Development
Health Spending Account and Benefits
Team happy hour and activities Calgary, Canada

Join our team as an iOS Developer

When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from Memorial Day through Labor Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!
We are looking for an iOS developer to build and support the CARFAX Car Care app. This exclusive app helps millions of our Car Care users maintain their cars and preserve its value in one convenient place. As an iOS developer on this team, you will be working alongside a small team of engineers and designers, with very high visibility to company leadership. You'll need to be innovative, collaborative, forward-thinking, and agile in the face of evolving requirements and priorities.
As an iOS Mobile Developer on this team, you will:
Help create solutions and build a complex application on the iOS platform, taking advantage of the latest Apple hardware and operating-system capabilities
Ensure the reliability and responsiveness of the application, seamlessly adapting whether connected to WiFi, LTE, or with no connection available at all
Collaborate with business customers, product managers, designers, and other developers to build out and support application features with a quick turnaround and iterative approach
Diagnose and fix issues discovered by QA testers and business users, and ensure timely release and deployment of updated app versions
Maintain clean, efficient, clearly-organized, and well-documented code
Gain experience with the Amazon Web Services (AWS) processes that provide data to the mobile app (current AWS experience is a definite plus!)
To be successful in this role, you will need:
Bachelors degree in Computer Science or equivalent IT field
2-3 years proven experience developing mobile applications for the iOS platform, with emphasis on the Swift language
Solid understanding of MVC / MVVM paradigms and Cocoa Touch design patterns
Experience with iOS frameworks such as UIKit, MapKit, Core Data, XCTest, and others
Understanding of Apple’s design principles and iOS Human Interface guidelines
Experience integrating with 3rd-party services such as RESTful APIs and SalesForce
Familiarity with UX design workflows and tools such as Invision
Proficiency with source-management tools such as Git or Gitlab
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment Join our team as an iOS Developer

Brand: Glentel Corporate

Location: Burnaby Office - 8501 Commerce Court, Burnaby, BC

Are you looking for a fast-paced and rewarding career to elevate your front-end and back-end software development experience?

The Full Stack Developer will be responsible for the design, development, delivery, and support of software solutions for various business units. These solutions cover a broad range of functions, from internal SharePoint sites used a communication hub to retail stores, to specific line-of-business applications which support various business processes at Glentel.

Responsibilities

Software design & development, under the guidance of a senior engineer:

Use modern software engineering processes to manage the design, documentation and implementation of (but not limited to):
Web-based applications
Mobile applications
Back-office data processing applications
Provide support and troubleshooting assistance to ensure the application integrity, stability and availability

End-User Support

Working with end-users to elicit and translate business requirements into specific software solutions

Why work with us

We provide competitive compensation, extended health benefits, annual incentive bonus plan, and RRSP company match program
We offer career advancement opportunities and challenge our employees to excel in their roles
We believe in supporting the communities in which we serve and encourage our employees to get involved
We believe in teamwork and are committed to creating a high-performing team that will help GLENTEL provide superior service to our customers

Qualifications

1 year of experience with front-end and back-end software development
Ability to quickly learn and apply new skills
Exposure to using Agile (or similar) software development methodologies
Exposure to all aspects of a project lifecycle, including: requirements gathering, project planning, development, testing, gathering end-user feedback (during and after development)
Previous knowledge/experience with:
Programming languages & frameworks
Web: Tech Stack, JS/CSS/HTML, NodeJS, EJS, MongoDB, Stateless Programming, React
Development Tools
Source code management systems: Git
Issue tracking systems
Security: web-based (WS-Federation, OAuth); traditional desktop (Windows AD)
User Interfaces
Automated testing, automated builds
Software documentation
Bachelor's degree in computer science or software engineering (or equivalent)
Excellent organizational and communication/interpersonal skills Brand: Glentel Corporate

ABOUT STOREFORCEStoreForce is deeply passionate about Specialty Retail – it’s in our roots and part of every single line of code we write. We’re known to say we’re Retailers first, and a technology vendor second. Every day we strive to help Specialty Retailers set a new standard for operational excellence.The StoreForce Team is dynamic, made of up diehard developers, seasoned retail veterans, tenacious sales reps, and devoted support specialists. And we’re looking for more, just like you, to join our team.This role is full time, permanent and reports to the Development Manager in our Toronto office.WHAT YOU'LL DO1. Development – Deliver high quality software SolutionsComplete programming of assigned software components for on-time delivery; development projects will include Xamarin, native Android/iOS or React Native.Participate in development discussions to collaborate on approach, functionality, look and feel.Conduct testing on assigned components.Maintain technical documentation as required.2. Issues Resolution – Demonstrate urgency in ensuring resolution of issuesCollaborate with the team to resolve issues; maintain open communication and provide updates.Troubleshoot issues, document findings and resolution, as required.WHAT YOU'LL NEED TO HAVEYou will be able to demonstrate your experience through your educational background and / or employment history.Minimum 3 years mobile application development experience, preferably in a commercial environment.Web development using HTML5, TypeScript or JavaScript is an asset.QUALIFICATIONS Competencies RequiredResults Focused– Demonstrates a desire for achieving results; is energized by achieving the goal.Detail Oriented – Able to think and articulate in very simple terms. Keen eye for detail and the ability to identify missing pieces.Problem Solving – Analytical. Able to see multiple parts and the relationships in order to identify and resolve the root issue.Self-motivated – Takes initiative and can work with limited direction and supervision to manage work schedule and responsibilities.Team Player - Collaborates with others; genuinely enjoys being a part of a team and shows support and interest towards co-workers.Service Oriented – Natural desire to provide assistance; achieves a sense of reward through helping others.WHY WORK WITH US AT STOREFORCEStoreForce is growing quickly – it’s the kind of place you can make a real impact. We thrive on change, collaboration, and trust; And are fueled by a mutual passion for Specialty Retail. At StoreForce you’ll have the chance not only to work with some amazing people, but also with some of the world’s best retail brands.We invest in our people, celebrate diversity, and foster a space for you to learn and grow, every day. We are committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment that is diverse and inclusive. This starts by welcoming and encouraging applications from all individuals including those with disabilities. And we’re looking for more, just like you, to join our team.This role is full time, permanent and reports to the Development Manager in our Toronto office.WHAT YOU'LL DO1. Development – Deliver high quality software SolutionsComplete programming of assigned software components for on-time delivery; development projects will include Xamarin, native Android/iOS or React Native.Participate in development discussions to collaborate on approach, functionality, look and feel.Conduct testing on assigned components.Maintain technical documentation as required.2. Keen eye for detail and the ability to identify missing pieces.Problem Solving – Analytical. Able to see multiple parts and the relationships in order to identify and resolve the root issue.Self-motivated – Takes initiative and can work with limited direction and supervision to manage work schedule and responsibilities.Team Player - Collaborates with others; genuinely enjoys being a part of a team and shows support and interest towards co-workers.Service Oriented – Natural desire to provide assistance; achieves a sense of reward through helping others.WHY WORK WITH US AT STOREFORCEStoreForce is growing quickly – it’s the kind of place you can make a real impact. job_title: Mobile Developer for NFT Ticketing App
listing_jobDesc:
Who is Recruiting from Scratch:
Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more.
If you are a fit, the team will reach out to you about this role or any others that may be a fit for our clients.
About the Role
The client is looking for a Mobile Developer to drive development on their NFT ticketing app. If you have a passion for mobile platforms, web3 and love using code to bring new user experiences to life, they would like to meet you. You will collaborate closely with internal teams to develop functional mobile applications, while working in a fast-paced environment.
Join us to build the next generation of mobile application to revolutionize the NFT ticketing experience.
What we hope you'll bring to the role:
Proven work experience as a Mobile Developer
Have used React Native to build cross platform mobile applications
Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the iOS App Store or the Android Play Store
In-depth knowledge of at least one programming language like Swift and Java
Experience with third-party libraries and APIs
Familiarity with OOP design principles
Excellent analytical skills with a good problem-solving attitude
Ability to perform in a team environment
A desire and ability to execute tactically but also think strategically with an eye towards leadership/management
You’re excited to join an early stage company and love a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
Self-motivated: capable of operating independently but also enjoy working collaboratively
Responsibilities:
Support the entire application lifecycle (concept, design, test, release, and support)
Produce fully functional mobile applications writing clean code
Gather specific requirements and suggest solutions
Write unit and UI tests
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance
Design interfaces to improve user experience
Liaise with Product to plan new features
Research and suggest new mobile products, applications and protocols
Stay up-to-date with new technology trends
Experience:
React Native experience
Expertise with iOS/Android
Excellent communication skills
Biased toward action and execution
You have a portfolio you can share
Benefits: PTO, Health Benefits, and More!

Goopter is an eCommerce tech company that focuses on mobile eCommerce solutions for small to medium-size business owners, we are an innovative, fast-growing high tech company based in Burnaby. Currently, we are looking for a junior mobile app developer to participate in our mobile app development project.As a Mobile Application Developer, you will participate in full-cycle mobile application development. This involves the design, development, testing, bug fixing, and enhancements of our mobile eCommerce products.Responsibilities include:Serving as an Android mobile development expert and a key contributor to our eCommerce businessContributing to the functional design and architecture of customer-facing, high trafficked mobile applications- Confirm requirements, coding, testing, analysis, design, definition, development, and implementation of mobile applicationBuilding complex Android mobile Applications; assist in web frontend development, bug fixing;Ensure expectations are met and work within tight project management schedules in an Agile development environmentRequired Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related fieldFull-cycle development experience with mobile applications (iPhone or Android)1+ years of experience with Swift, Kotlin, or Java;Experience with Git, SQL, XML, JSON, and Web Service;Proficient in fundamentals of object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem-solving, and complexity analysis;Knowledge of web service technologies and services (specifically REST APIs);Android development experienceExcellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate technical issues to a non-technical person;Experience in web technologies is a plus: PHP, React, Redux, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTTP, Nginx, HTML5, and familiarity with Unix/Linux- UI Design experience for mobile or the web;To apply for the position, please indicate if you are holding working visa or you are PR/citizen in the application, email your resume and cover letter to us, we thank all interested applicants; however, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.The position will start with 6 months contract, there's opportunity to move into full-time position if you can demonstrate outstanding performance.Job Type: Fixed term contractContract length: 6 monthsSalary: $30,000.00-$50,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus paySchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Burnaby, BC V5J4K2: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (preferred) Goopter is an eCommerce tech company that focuses on mobile eCommerce solutions for small to medium-size business owners, we are an innovative, fast-growing high tech company based in Burnaby. This involves the design, development, testing, bug fixing, and enhancements of our mobile eCommerce products.Responsibilities include:Serving as an Android mobile development expert and a key contributor to our eCommerce businessContributing to the functional design and architecture of customer-facing, high trafficked mobile applications- Confirm requirements, coding, testing, analysis, design, definition, development, and implementation of mobile applicationBuilding complex Android mobile Applications; assist in web frontend development, bug fixing;Ensure expectations are met and work within tight project management schedules in an Agile development environmentRequired Qualifications:Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related fieldFull-cycle development experience with mobile applications (iPhone or Android)1+ years of experience with Swift, Kotlin, or Java;Experience with Git, SQL, XML, JSON, and Web Service;Proficient in fundamentals of object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem-solving, and complexity analysis;Knowledge of web service technologies and services (specifically REST APIs);Android development experienceExcellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to communicate technical issues to a non-technical person;Experience in web technologies is a plus: PHP, React, Redux, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, HTTP, Nginx, HTML5, and familiarity with Unix/Linux- UI Design experience for mobile or the web;To apply for the position, please indicate if you are holding working visa or you are PR/citizen in the application, email your resume and cover letter to us, we thank all interested applicants; Cranberry a TripleOne company is looking for an Android & iOS Mobile Developer who possesses an expert knowledge of Android and iOS mobile technologies and will work with our design team to build the next generation of our mobile applications. The candidate must pay special attention to the application’s compatibility with multiple versions of Android and iOS device types.As part of the Cranberry team, you will work with the brand, development, and web development team to offer a truly integrated experience. You will be a part of a rapidly growing and innovative, talented team where you can learn and grow, and where your talent, skill, and hard work will be valued and rewarded.You will play a key-role in the success of the company, notably by developing the software architecture of the first decentralized company in the world.We want a developer that possesses passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits.Qualifications: · iOS: A deep familiarity with Swift, Objective-C and Cocoa Touch· iOS: Expert knowledge of the iOS 11+ SDK;· iOS: Experience working with iOS frameworks such as UIKit, Foundation, AVFoundation, Core Data, Core Animation, Core Graphics, Core Location, Auto Layout, Size Classes, Grand Central Dispatch, Extensions and Asset Catalogs· iOS: Experience with third party libraries and APIs such as Firebase Analytics, Realm Database, Alamofire, Reactive Programming (RxSwift)· iOS: Experience with debugging tools such as lldb; revision control systems such as Git; continuous integration with Xcode bots and the Xcode Server· iOS: Familiar with compiler optimization tools such as Link-Time Optimization (LTO), Profile Guided Optimization (PGO), Loop Unrolling, Modules, “-Ounchecked” for Swift code generation, and “-Ofast”.·· Android: Develop new features and improvements on Android & be responsible for quality throughout the development process.· Android: Collaborate and act as technical reference within the mobile team, and coach junior developers to use best practices to develop and test Android apps.· Android: Collaborate with Scrum Masters, Mobile Developers, Business System Analysts, User Experience architects and Testing Specialists to deliver high quality solutions· Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS (must have) & Android (NTH) applications to back-end services· Experience with performance and memory optimization using tools such as instruments.· Experience with common Software Engineering design patterns such as Model-View-Controller (MVC), MVVM, VIPER, Singleton, Delegation, Observer, and Abstract Factory.· Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.· Maintain code integrity and organization.· Experience working in agile software development environments using Scrum methodologies with sprints, daily stand-ups, user stories, epics, storyboards, and pair programming.Be involved in scrum ceremonies to plan, estimate, design, develop and test features for deployment into productionParticipate in the discovery and evaluation of new technologies.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From $50,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsDental careDiscounted or free foodExtended health careOn-site gymOn-site parkingVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Saint-Laurent, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) Cranberry a TripleOne company is looking for an Android & iOS Mobile Developer who possesses an expert knowledge of Android and iOS mobile technologies and will work with our design team to build the next generation of our mobile applications. The candidate must pay special attention to the application’s compatibility with multiple versions of Android and iOS device types.As part of the Cranberry team, you will work with the brand, development, and web development team to offer a truly integrated experience. You will be a part of a rapidly growing and innovative, talented team where you can learn and grow, and where your talent, skill, and hard work will be valued and rewarded.You will play a key-role in the success of the company, notably by developing the software architecture of the first decentralized company in the world.We want a developer that possesses passion for pushing mobile technologies to the limits.Qualifications: · iOS: A deep familiarity with Swift, Objective-C and Cocoa Touch· iOS: Expert knowledge of the iOS 11+ SDK;· iOS: Experience working with iOS frameworks such as UIKit, Foundation, AVFoundation, Core Data, Core Animation, Core Graphics, Core Location, Auto Layout, Size Classes, Grand Central Dispatch, Extensions and Asset Catalogs· iOS: Experience with third party libraries and APIs such as Firebase Analytics, Realm Database, Alamofire, Reactive Programming (RxSwift)· iOS: Experience with debugging tools such as lldb; revision control systems such as Git; continuous integration with Xcode bots and the Xcode Server· iOS: Familiar with compiler optimization tools such as Link-Time Optimization (LTO), Profile Guided Optimization (PGO), Loop Unrolling, Modules, “-Ounchecked” for Swift code generation, and “-Ofast”.·· Android: Develop new features and improvements on Android & be responsible for quality throughout the development process.· Android: Collaborate and act as technical reference within the mobile team, and coach junior developers to use best practices to develop and test Android apps.· Android: Collaborate with Scrum Masters, Mobile Developers, Business System Analysts, User Experience architects and Testing Specialists to deliver high quality solutions· Familiarity with RESTful APIs to connect iOS (must have) & Android (NTH) applications to back-end services· Experience with performance and memory optimization using tools such as instruments.· Experience with common Software Engineering design patterns such as Model-View-Controller (MVC), MVVM, VIPER, Singleton, Delegation, Observer, and Abstract Factory.· Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of applications.· Maintain code integrity and organization.· Experience working in agile software development environments using Scrum methodologies with sprints, daily stand-ups, user stories, epics, storyboards, and pair programming.Be involved in scrum ceremonies to plan, estimate, design, develop and test features for deployment into productionParticipate in the discovery and evaluation of new technologies.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: From $50,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsDental careDiscounted or free foodExtended health careOn-site gymOn-site parkingVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Saint-Laurent, QC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) Show more

Company Description
ISAAC partners with North American fleets to provide a user-friendly solution that simplifies trucking. Focused 100% on the trucking industry, we help carriers overcome challenges, while boosting driver happiness. With proven system reliability and system integration capabilities driven by our open platform, our solution helps your drivers and back-office team work smoothly. For more information, visit www.isaacinstruments.com.

Job Description
ISAAC Instruments, a fast-growing company, is seeking a Mobile Application Developer to join its R & D team.
As a mobile Application Developer, you will participate in the design and coding of mobile apps under the Xamarin platform.
Responsibilities
Developing mobile applications based on defined requirements
Assisting in all aspects of mobile app development
Participating in development meetings and applying Agile and Scrum best practices
Participating in the maintenance of existing applications
Delivering high-quality code
Testing and documenting the features developed
Conducting code reviews

Qualifications

Experience in developing mobile apps
Experience using REST type services
Good knowledge of C# and Xamarin
Development experience on Android
Knowledge of MVVM pattern, dependency injection and event stream processing
Ability to learn new technologies quickly
Performance driven
Ability to adapt and work in existing applications
Good understanding of multitier architecture
Assets
Good knowledge of Android UX development (AXML)
Knowledge of MVVM Light or MVVMCross libraries
Knowledge of SQLite or of any other mobile apps database
Additional Information
Collaborators are at the center of ISAAC’s interests and values. This explains the numerous benefits of working at ISAAC, namely:
varied career opportunities
a stimulating work environment focused on innovation
enthusiastic and collaborative teams
competitive salaries and benefits promoting work-life balance: a complete group insurance plan, group RRSP, an EAP, flexible hours, 4 weeks of vacation, etc
various social activities and free snacks every day Company Description

Position Description:
Our Client provides strategic partnership, and project execution to Bank retail branches across Canada, primary internet sites as Online Banking, mobile banking, etc. As a Senior Application Developer you will be responsible for the native iOS application development as well as the maintenance of and enhancements to the existing features. The Senior Application Developer will effectively work with the team to work on immediate/future needs, will convey those results to our partners and extended teams in a meaningful way, and will deliver solutions in a proactive, fast-paced, Agile development environment.
Your future duties and responsibilities:
Programming Skills - Participate in the development and maintenance of stable and highly secure iOS applications, and be responsible for the product development. Responsible for providing hands-on architectural design for native iOS applications with a deep understanding of design patterns such as MVP, MVVM, and VIPER.Planning and Coordination - Participate in the discussion and execution of the project implementation plan. Complete the preparation of the project requirements, outline, detailed designs, and other documentation. Responsible for the project subsystem or module design and coding. Work with stakeholders, end users, business analysts, and technical resources to gather requirements and prepare design specifications.Collaboration - Foster and encourage a collaborative development culture, where we elevate each other through mentorship. Participate in code reviews and Scrum ceremonies to continuously improve the products and the team processes. Work effectively in an Agile Software Development and Extreme Programming environment.
Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
You can demonstrate 5+ experience in native iOS development using Swift and Objective-C. You have hands-on experience in Xcode, Cocoapods, CoreData, iOS design patterns, Storyboards, and iOS accessibility guidelines. You regularly write Unit Tests as part of your application development process, and you have familiarity with Test Driven Development. You are strongly familiar with Continuous Integration/Deployment methodologies and have experience using tools to facilitate this.You embrace and champion change. You'll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.You look beyond the moment. You make decisions and take actions that will make a difference today and tomorrow. You proactively seek new opportunities to define what's possible.You’re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You can easily adapt to new tools and trends.You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You're confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

Insights you can act on

While technology is at the heart of our clients’ digital transformation, we understand that people are at the heart of business success.


When you join CGI, you become a trusted advisor, collaborating with colleagues and clients to bring forward actionable insights that deliver meaningful and sustainable outcomes. We call our employees "members" because they are CGI shareholders and owners and owners who enjoy working and growing together to build a company we are proud of. This has been our Dream since 1976, and it has brought us to where we are today — one of the world’s largest independent providers of IT and business consulting services.

At CGI, we recognize the richness that diversity brings. We strive to create a work culture where all belong and collaborate with clients in building more inclusive communities. As an equal-opportunity employer, we want to empower all our members to succeed and grow. If you require an accommodation at any point during the recruitment process, please let us know. We will be happy to assist.

Job Summary
Trainerize powered by ABC Fitness Solutions (www.trainerize.com) is looking for a Mobile Developer to add to our growing development team. This is an exciting opportunity to join a fast-growing technology company making waves in the fitness industry.
Trainerize customers are fitness businesses and professionals, and our goal is to make them more accessible to more people in the world. Trainerize powered by ABC Fitness Solutions is an integral part of ABC Fitness Solutions' club management solution, enabling fitness businesses to train, coach, encourage and hold clients and members accountable to achieve their goals.
Responsibilities:
General responsibility to design, develop, test and document software for current and new products, specifically:
Design and build applications for iOS and Android platforms using cross-platform frameworks.
Write and maintain unit testing and automation testing.
Collaborate with a scrum team to design, develop and ship new features.
Review code and handle merge requests from other developers.
Work with Senior staff to breakdown tasks and provide estimation.
Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs.
Help maintain code quality, organization, and automatization.
Requirements:
Minimum bachelor's degree in computer science or completion of a college program in web design, computer science, graphic arts or a related field.
Minimum 1 year of mobile application development experience.
Minimum 1 year of experience developing React Native apps.
In-depth understanding of JavaScript programming and familiar with ES6, Typescript.
Familiarity with RESTful APIs or similar technologies to interface iOS/Android applications with back-end services.
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools such as Git and the associated best practices.
Experience with other Cross platform frameworks such as Xamarin, Flutter, NativeScript, Corona or similar is a plus.
Experience with native mobile development on Android (Java) or iOS (Objective C/Swift) is a plus.
Familiar with iOS build and Apple App store submitting process.
Familiar with Android build and Google Play store submitting process.
Good verbal & written communications skills. Job Summary

About Lim Geomatics:
Lim Geomatics is an industry-leading GIS company that develops geospatial software and data for the forest industry to help forestry companies be more efficient with their office and field operations. By doing so, we empower data-driven sustainable forest management.
With our Forestry Geospatial Platform, forestry companies can uncover actionable insights for their timber harvesting supply chain and target, benchmark and optimize forest operations. Compared with other competitive solutions, our products are the only ones that integrate fully with the ArcGIS platform, thereby letting organizations leverage their existing investments in enterprise GIS technology.
At Lim Geomatics, we think outside the box and collaborate with our customers to provide solutions to their problems. We never settle for status quo; always delivering and delighting clients with innovative and practical outcomes. We celebrate diversity while leveraging the creativity and technical expertise of our team. At Lim Geomatics you will help dream up and realize innovative game-changing products and solutions for our global customers in the natural resources sector. Lim Geomatics, was the winner of Tecterra’s 2019 Company of the Year award and was listed in Canada’s Tops Growing Companies in 2021.
About you:
As an experienced mobile developer, you understand that it’s an unpredictable world out there and it’s your job to manage it using clean patterns. You’re comfortable with targeting multiple platforms and designing your code around their idiosyncrasies. You have an opinion when it comes to design and take pride in educating others about mobile-friendly UI/UX. Customer satisfaction, team collaboration, and the importance of team reflection and constant improvement are your top priorities.
What you’ll do and how you’ll make an impact:

As a key team member, you will help to scope, plan, and execute mobile application development.
Collaborate with stakeholders and team members to iterate on solutions and to continually deliver value to our clients.
Improve the application delivery process using automation and writing testable software.
Contribute to solutions for new and interesting problems, which often involve spatiotemporal components.
Participate in the product testing and peer review process.
Develop yourself personally and professionally by actively setting and achieving ambitious goals.
Impact Lim Geomatics' growth by developing great mobile applications and solutions.


What we’re looking for:

Comfortable with Agile development practices, working in small teams running modern dev ops.
5+ years of mobile development experience. Cross-platform mobile development, C# and .NET knowledge, and Xamarin experience would be an asset.
Experience mentoring team members on best practices.
Experience troubleshooting mobile device connectivity (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth) and GPS.
Experience with development environments on both Windows and MacOS.
Experience with Esri technology and mapping solutions would be an asset.
Experience with SQL and database technologies.
Experience using peripheral sensors (GPS, Camera, Bluetooth, Motion) and their data would be an asset.
Able to manage a workload that may touch on a few different applications any given week.
You can independently research and implement solutions to complex problems.


What we can offer you

Remote work opportunities
RRSP matching
Medical benefits

Level: Intermediate
Location: Canada > Edmonton
Start Date: Immediate
We are reinventing the construction workface

Intelliwave Technologies formed in 2007 to provide new solutions in the construction industry to help increase “Time on tools” for craft labor and improve site safety. To accomplish these goals Intelliwave focused on providing construction projects with automation and unparalleled visibility in 3 core areas: materials, equipment and workforce. The result was the creation of a revolutionary web and mobile-based software solution in one encompassing brand, SiteSense®.
You will:

Develop and maintain SiteSense mobile apps, helping workers on jobsites improve safety and productivity.
Work with other team members and stakeholders across the company to bring new features and products to SiteSense mobile.
Develop using React Native or Ionic to build cross platform apps.
Work on mobile specific APIs that help facilitate authentication, data syncing and enforce business logic.

You may be fit for this role if you:

Have a strong technical background, with 3+ years of experience in mobile development, including 1+ years of experience with React Native and/or React/Vue.
Experience with ES6 JavaScript
Prefer simple solutions and designs over complex ones, and have a good intuition for what is lasting and scalable
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts can put yourself in the shoes of your users and be a steward of crafting great user experiences


Culture & Values:

Learn more at https://www.intelliwavetechnologies.com/company
Apply Today:

Submit application to jobs@intelliwavetechnologies.com Level: Intermediate
Location: Canada > Edmonton
Start Date: Immediate

Develop and maintain SiteSense mobile apps, helping workers on jobsites improve safety and productivity.
Work with other team members and stakeholders across the company to bring new features and products to SiteSense mobile.
Develop using React Native or Ionic to build cross platform apps.
Work on mobile specific APIs that help facilitate authentication, data syncing and enforce business logic.

You may be fit for this role if you:

Have a strong technical background, with 3+ years of experience in mobile development, including 1+ years of experience with React Native and/or React/Vue.
Experience with ES6 JavaScript
Prefer simple solutions and designs over complex ones, and have a good intuition for what is lasting and scalable
Thrive in a collaborative environment involving different stakeholders and subject matter experts can put yourself in the shoes of your users and be a steward of crafting great user experiences

Intermediate Software EngineerService-link provides mobile workforce management software to clients around the world. We strive to provide our customers with reliable and quality software in addition to fast customer service to maintain customer productivity.We are a rapidly-growing, interconnected team of around 20 employees. We are looking for a programmer who is able to work in both frontend and backend web development, with an interest in applying new technologies to serve customer needs.We are looking for someone who is self motivated, and thrives in an independent work environment. If creating new and innovative programs to solve problems sounds interesting, you’re the right person for the job. We provide a flexible schedule, pathway to senior positions, and performance based bonus structure.Responsibilities:Building and maintaining Java Applications with Jakarta EEWork with colleagues to identify and communicate product issues and implementation pathsWork directly with customers to build features and resolve issuesDevelop, debug, review and maintain high-quality codePrimary Qualifications:Strong attention to detailSelf motivated and independent problem solverFluent with JavaExperience with SQL databasesExperience with the Java ecosystemExperience developing server-side web applicationsStrong written and oral English skillsAdditional Qualifications (Bonus points):Knowledge of Frontend TypescriptReact ExperienceTo Apply:Please submit your resume, no cover letter needed - prior projects and experience are highly valued.Application process:1) Resume - checking to see whether the primary qualifications are met. We'll then arrange a time for the coding test.2) Coding test - a 2 hour long practical coding test to test knowledge of Java. The test will be two questions to be completed without supervision using whatever tools (IDE, google) you are most comfortable with. There will be a google meet call just before to make sure you are setup and resolve if there any confusion about the questions.3) Personal Interview - a 30 minute online interview to discuss the coding test, your resume, and answer your questions about us.4) Final interview - a discussion with the CEO to get to know you and discuss details about salary and starting working at Service-link.This is an in-office, full-time position to begin asap.Job Type: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $78 000.00 - $100 000.00 per year + potential bonusJob Type: Full-timeSalary: $78,000.00-$100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Casual dressFlextimeSchedule:8 hour shiftSupplemental pay types:Bonus payAbility to commute/relocate:North Vancouver, BC: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required) Intermediate Software EngineerService-link provides mobile workforce management software to clients around the world. Tech company in Canada is looking to hire Intermediate PHP/React developers!
IMPORTANT: Job is fully remote
The Intermediate Developer is responsible for:

Developing new product features
Monitor for and mitigate software service issues and bugs
Monitor for and mitigate platform performance issues (web app and mobile app)
Sprint development, FSD and Technical spec writing, ticket estimation, sprint tracking and releases
Regularly communicate and collaborate with other members of the team
Engage in mindful peer code-review and productively incorporate suggestions made by teammates

The Ideal Candidates has:

Excellent communication skills
Take great care about the quality of their code with the willingness to evolve
Genuine passion for technology
Natural problem solver
Highly organized with strong attention to detail
Motivated and proactive with the ability to prioritize and effectively meet tight deadlines
Curiosity to create learning opportunities
Confidence to voice your own opinions and the ability to take direction

Technical Qualifications:

5+ years web development experience
Highly skilled and capable of both front and back end development
Expertise in React, React Native, PHP
Working knowledge with AWS infrastructure, Sentry, CircleCI, iOS App Store and Android Play Store, Click-up and Mailchimp for mailouts
Fluent in English; Spanish is an asset

What We Offer:
A competitive compensation package
Strong onboarding program
Ability to work remotely
Team events
Recognition programs
Learning opportunities to develop new skills and progress your career
A fun, professional and personable team! Must-have skills

listing_jobDesc: Fall 2022 Co-Op: IT and Web DeveloperJob Type: Co-op (Full-time/Part-time)Co-op Start Date: Fall 2022, September 1st*There will be One (1) Pre-position training 2-4 weeks before starting date**Recruited members will be working remotely from home, and we welcome international applicants. FANIQUE is seeking an IT and Web developer (Co-op Summer 2022) who loves to work in Fashion, Lifestyle, and Technology sectors. If you look forward to growing within a fast-paced startup environment, love to learn what's connecting brands with customers, and are constantly eager to improve your professional work skills, please read on.About YouA passionate and hardworking learner who likes to grow with the company and has the potential to take on additional roles and responsibilities as the business grows. You are proud of your work and being part of a team. You love solving problems and taking on challenges.About FANIQUEFANIQUE Group - www.faniquegroup.comFANIQUE is an innovative incubator for business in LIFESTYLE, TECH, and FASHION. The unique business model of FANIQUE creates a sustainably circular system to help innovations to grow that includes three divisions of a publication platform FANIQUE.com (aka. FANIQUE Magazine), an e-commerce platform F Store, and a concept space/hotel business, F Space. We aim to inspire global audiences and unite industry professionals worldwide.F Store: www.fstore.worldF Space: www.fspace.worldFANIQUE Magazine: www.fanique.comWhat You Will DoResponsibilities include, but are not limited to:Assisting the web development team with all aspects of website and application design.Assisting with the testing and maintenance of backend and front-end applications.Brainstorming new tech applications such as digital storage and mobile technology.Collaborating with developers to implement new web features.Keeping up to date with the latest technology and programming trends.Converting video, audio, written, and graphic components into compatible formats for the web.Using user feedback to identify and correct problems with a client's website.What Skills you haveA Bachelor's degree in information technology, computer science, or a similar field.Experience working with coding languages such as HTML, Python JQuery, JSON, and Ajax.Solid understanding of web design and development principles.Good planning, analytical, and decision-making skills.A portfolio of web design and projects you have worked on.Critical-thinking skills.Flexibility in the workplace.In-depth knowledge of software prototyping and UX design tools.Goal-orientated and deadline-driven.Contract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20 hours per week (Minimum); 3 days per week (Minimum)Expected start date: 2022-09-01Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Internship / Co-opContract length: 4 monthsPart-time hours: 20 per weekSchedule:8 hour shiftExpected start date: 2022-09-01 Fall 2022 Co-Op: IT and Web DeveloperJob Type: Co-op (Full-time/Part-time)Co-op Start Date: Fall 2022, September 1st*There will be One (1) Pre-position training 2-4 weeks before starting date**Recruited members will be working remotely from home, and we welcome international applicants. Intelliware is looking for a mobile developer to join our team!
At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of consumer and enterprise mobile applications. We have virtual collaborative project rooms where you’ll work closely with a cross functional team including client subject matter experts, end users, and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.
We’re looking for generalists who have the ability and interest to work with more than one mobile platform. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies. We develop and deliver native iOS, native Android, and responsive web apps.
While working with a team in an agile environment, you will be:
Developing creative, innovative and practical mobile solutions
Estimating, tasking and prototyping
Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase
Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation
Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes
Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives
’Must Have’ Skills/Experience:
Experience developing and releasing a native mobile application with iOS and/or Android
Experience working with Xcode, Android Studio, or other mobile IDE
Fluent and current in HTML5, CSS and JavaScript
Knowledgeable and interested in User Experience best practices and design
Strong communication skills
’Nice to Have’ Skills/Experience:
Exposure to and enthusiasm for Agile approaches to software development e.g. testing, continuous integration, project rooms, pair programming, etc.
Experience developing and releasing a native mobile application with React Native, Ionic, or Flutter
Experience with Social Network APIs such as Google APIs, Facebook and Twitter
Experience with distributed version control
Experience releasing to Google Play Console or iTunes App Store
For more info on Intelliware, check out our Careers Page and Instagram.
Intelliware is committed to diversity in the workplace. We are an inclusive employer and welcome and encourage applications from all qualified candidates. Applicants’ needs will be accommodated during our recruitment and selection process so please advise us if you require accommodation. Intelliware is looking for a mobile developer to join our team!

At Punchcard, we’re in the process of inventing a new type of consulting agency, and we need great people to come along this journey with us. Our clients come to us to help them solve interesting challenges using technology. We are scaling our team and are looking for a Senior Mobile Application Developer to support the operations of the organization.

You'll be joining our team at an interesting time; we are still small, but we are growing, and we need people to help shape the future of Punchcard. If you have several years of experience as a software developer, have worked on projects with a variety of clients and users and are excited about the opportunity to work with and mentor a growing team and roll up your sleeves to create some amazing software, then this could be the role for you.

Your Typical Day

Starting in the morning, you’ll gather with your project team and project leads to go over everything that happened in the previous day, and all the context necessary for today. Blockers will be raised, and plans made to mitigate or remove them. If clarity is needed, the daily stand-up is where you’ll find it.

From there, you’ll fire up your IDE (we like VS Code) and start working, finding some available tasks in Dev Ops. If you’ve got questions, your fellow leads are just a collaboration call away, where you can pair program on difficult tasks or explore solutions together. Once you’ve finished a task or user story, it’s off to git to check it in via pull request for approval and final checks.

Finally, the whole team gets together to scope out and reflect on the days work, figure out what tomorrow looks like, and send the client a build.

Responsibilities

Technical

Support the entire application lifecycle (shape, design, test, release, and support).
Produce fully functional mobile applications writing modular, well-tested and maintainable code.
Apply a principled agile software development methodology to the organization.
Troubleshoot and debug to optimize performance.
Liaise with design and product team to plan new features.
Ensure new and legacy applications meet quality standards.
Research and suggest new mobile products, applications, and protocols.
Stay up to date with new technology trends.

Leadership

Responsible for directing the development team in the design, coding, testing, and debugging of applications.
Ensuring documentation and good process around the use of Dev Ops for project teams.
Continually identify areas of improvement with respect to development process, product maintainability, quality, and technology stack.
Lead by example to develop a team culture of ownership and accountability.
Consistently deliver on commitments made internally and externally and hold others to the same high standards of accountability.

Necessary Skills

A love of solving interesting problems.
3 - 5+ years of actual experience working as a software developer.
Demonstrable portfolio of released applications on the App store or the Android market.
In-depth experience with React, React Native or another JavaScript framework.
Experience with back-end technologies such as C# or .NETCore.
Familiarity with cloud and CI/CD systems such as Fastlane, Microsoft Azure, DevOps and AppCenter.
Any experience with native iOS/Android code via Objective-C, Swift, Java or Kotlin is an asset. Experience with native modules in React-Native preferred but not required.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to multi-task to manage competing demands.
A degree in computer science, design, business, or technology or comparable work experience.
High personal integrity and team-orientation.
An entrepreneurial spirit.
Excellent leadership skills.

What to Expect

Engaging and challenging projects – if you want to do the same thing over and over again, Punchcard isn’t for you. If like puzzles and solving problems, then we are for you.
A competitive salary, commensurate with your experience.
Employee group benefits (including disability and life insurance, dental, and extended health).
Flexible hours, a workplace dedicated to creativity, as well as a kitchen stocked with all the snacks you can think of – including the best coffee we can get.
A highly collaborative work environment, which a group of people who love what they do.
Challenging projects while working with the most interesting technologies.
Opportunities for advancement, professional development, and the opportunity to be mentored by industry leaders.
A cool place to work in the heart of downtown Edmonton right on 104th Street, once we are back in the office. The team is currently working remotely.
An opportunity to work with and learn from passionate and highly skilled team members who work together to ensure everyone succeeds.

We always look for people who are comfortable wearing different hats, so don’t worry if you don’t think you’re a perfect fit for the role – we’re still interested in hearing from you.

At Punchcard, we are an equal opportunity employer, and we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need. Our client is looking for someone that is an experienced mobile developer with React Native to help us build a digital social platform for youth and amateur sports.
The candidate should have 4+ years of experience writing native mobile applications (iOS or Android) and some amount of React Native expertise or have deep expertise in building a highly scaled application in React.js with aspirations to work on a mobile app. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy challenging work, then this will be a perfect fit. Your talent will let you define your own future.

Responsibilities:

Design and build applications for iOS and Android platforms using React Native

Collaborate with a team to design, develop and ship new features

Identify and correct bottlenecks and fix bugs

Help maintain code quality, organization, and automation

Use your knowledge of software engineering concepts to design and implement tested, reusable, and modular code

Apply knowledge of the business goals to derive innovative solutions for the project, team, and group

Be an active learner who is up for expanding your breadth of knowledge

Have passion for your craft. You feel ownership over everything you ship

Skills And Experience:
3+ years of JavaScript experience, including concepts like asynchronous programming, closures, types, and ES5/ES6
2+ years of professional React.js or React Native programming experience
Experience with native mobile development on Android or iOS
Familiarity with RESTful APIs or similar technologies to interface iOS/Android applications with back-end services
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field, or 4+ year relevant work experience
Proficiency with package management tools such as NPM, CocoaPods, and Gradle
Proficiency with XCode and/or Android Studio
Experience with modern JavaScript libraries such as React, React Native, Redux, Apollo, etc.
Experience using Git and related tools like GitLab, GitHub, Bitbucket, etc
Experience with front-end performance topics / rendering internals
Experience delivering feature-level technical design and documentation
Understanding of design principles for iOS and Android
Bonus Skills And Experience:
Experience with Typescript
Experience with UI / UX
Experience with JIRA
Experience with Agile / SCRUM development methodologies
Experience in writing and understanding user stories
You've contributed to an open source project or participated in the wider Javascript/React Native communities Must-have skills

job_title: SYSTEM DEVELOPMENT SPECIALIST (Front-End / Mobile Hybrid App Developer)
listing_jobDesc:
Job Category: Infromation & Technology
Division & Section: Technology Services, Office of the Chief Technology Officer
Work Location: Metro Hall, 55 John St
Job Type & Duration: Permanent, Full-time
Hourly Rate: $ 49.44 - $54.16
Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week
Affiliation: L79 Full-time
Number of Positions Open: 1
Posting Period: 5- Aug-2022 to 19-Aug-2022


Job Description

As a System Development Specialist (Front-End / Mobile Hybrid App Developer), you will be working on public and staff single page and mobile applications for the City of Toronto. In this role, you will be maintaining applications built on our existing frameworks and helping the team migrate and adopt new Front-End frameworks. You will be working with existing microservice API solutions and applying configuration to customize these APIs for your Front-End applications. As a part of the team, you will get to work through all phases of the software development life cycle and contribute in the development of corporate system architecture, methodologies, standards, policies, procedures and guidelines.
Major Responsibilities:
Performs analysis and design duties as well as programming, modelling and scripting, testing, documentation and deployment preparation.
Coordinates and prepares needs analysis and detailed component design.
Conducts user interviews to determine detailed systems requirements.
Completes preliminary analysis, system and functional design, workflow diagrams for quality systems development.
Prepares front-end prototypes and mockups of user interface.
Designs, codes, tests, implements and maintains shared JavaScript libraries and components.
Designs, codes, tests, implements and maintains HTML5 and hybrid mobile apps.
Designs and develops systems that comply with access and privacy legislation.
Coordinates and develops program specifications and documentation.
Designs and conducts all levels of testing i.e. unit, system, integration, regression, performance, security, usability, optimization/configuration and coordinates user acceptance testing.
Liaises and coordinates with internal and external consultants in detailed systems deliverables and technical problem resolution.
Implements enterprise in-house developed/custom/packaged systems, component releases, and systems changes.
Tests integrated systems to ensure system compatibility and proper functional integration.
Provides application maintenance and enhancement including implementation of vendor systems fixes and patches.
Conducts quality assurance on departmental and external developments.
Develops systems interfaces between enterprise and divisional systems.
Performs information and application data conversions.
Provides development support to users by providing technical assistance and troubleshooting.
Provides documentation and instruction/training to users of the system.
Designs and develops application security interfaces to enable clients in controlling and administering access to their systems.
Provides expertise, advice and technical skills for information and application service delivery.
Conducts research and evaluation of hardware/software/framework and makes recommendations.
Recommends, presents and demonstrates system solutions to City management and corporate business clients.
Conducts presentations, system demonstrations and system walk-throughs at project review meetings.
Participates as a team member in the execution of project plans providing technical expertise and advice re: architecture, development tools, work effort estimates.
Contributes to project charters, statements of work and project plans, project status reports and variance explanations, risk identification and mitigation planning.
Conducts research, investigates and recommends best practices for information and application services.
Contributes to post-implementation project reviews.
Recommends improvements to current methodologies, processes, standards, policies and guidelines.
Contributes in planning of future system growth and provides detailed work plans.
Participates in enterprise projects.
Conducts feasibility studies. Contribute to business cases, RFI/P/Q’s, technical reports by researching and participating in evaluations and recommending solutions.
Determines user training needs.
Key Qualifications:
Your application must describe your qualifications as they relate to:
Extensive experience in business system analysis, rapid application development and programming in a large, diverse computing environment.
Extensive experience in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, and Bootstrap.
Extensive experience in using REST APIs, including JSON and XML APIs.
Experience developing digital products that comply with accessibility standards and/or best practices (WCAG 2.x AA, AODA, WAI-ARIA).
Experience optimizing for the accessibility features of the platform (HTML, iOS, Android).
Experience developing Hybrid Mobile applications for Andriod and iOS using Apache Cordova framework, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
Experience creating program specifications and code documents including use cases, business process models, swimlane process, entity relationship diagrams, class and component models.
Experience developing and/or maintaining large scale information technology applications.
Experience in working effectively with a group of multidisciplinary staff in a project team setting.
Post-secondary education in computer science or a related discipline, or the approved equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
You must also have:
Ability to effectively communicate.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively as a member of a team, collaboratively with others in multidisciplinary team environment and work independently, as required.
Ability to be self-motivated and work with minimal supervision.
Ability to negotiate effective resolution of conflicting business priorities with corporate business
Strong analytical, problem solving, listening and interacting skills.
Demonstrated business acumen to establish and maintain effective consulting relationships with corporate clients and vendors, using a strong customer service orientation.
Ability to work with competing demands, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of hybrid mobile apps development and Cordova is an asset.
Knowledge of current and emerging technologies relating to data warehousing, e-service, quality assurance tools, data retention and document management/imaging.
Experience in the following is an asset: Java, iOS mobile app development, Android mobile app development, OData, SAP Fiori, SAP UI5, SharePoint 2013, Oracle PL/SQL, Software AG WebMethods, web communication, Scrum rapid application development methodology.
Ability to be on call for support of production systems.
Willing to work flexible hours including days, afternoons, nights and weekends, as required.

Note: All City of Toronto employees are required to be fully vaccinated as a condition of hire in accordance with the City's Mandatory Vaccination Policy. Candidates will be required to show proof of vaccination during the recruitment process.
NOTE TO INTERNAL FULL-TIME AND PART-TIME CITY OF TORONTO EMPLOYEES:
City of Toronto employees must apply to full-time or part-time employment opportunities posted on the City's Internal Job Posting Portal.
Note: The applicant pool from this job posting may be used for similar summer job opportunities in various divisions.
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City’s commitment to employment equity.
Accommodation
The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request. Learn more about the City’s Hiring Policies and Accommodation Process. Extensive experience in business system analysis, rapid application development and programming in a large, diverse computing environment.
Extensive experience in HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, JQuery, and Bootstrap.
Extensive experience in using REST APIs, including JSON and XML APIs.
Experience developing digital products that comply with accessibility standards and/or best practices (WCAG 2.x AA, AODA, WAI-ARIA).
Experience optimizing for the accessibility features of the platform (HTML, iOS, Android).
Experience developing Hybrid Mobile applications for Andriod and iOS using Apache Cordova framework, HTML, JavaScript, and CSS
Experience creating program specifications and code documents including use cases, business process models, swimlane process, entity relationship diagrams, class and component models.
Experience developing and/or maintaining large scale information technology applications.
Experience in working effectively with a group of multidisciplinary staff in a project team setting.
Post-secondary education in computer science or a related discipline, or the approved equivalent combination of education and/or experience.
You must also have:
Ability to effectively communicate.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to work effectively as a member of a team, collaboratively with others in multidisciplinary team environment and work independently, as required.
Ability to be self-motivated and work with minimal supervision.
Ability to negotiate effective resolution of conflicting business priorities with corporate business
Strong analytical, problem solving, listening and interacting skills.
Demonstrated business acumen to establish and maintain effective consulting relationships with corporate clients and vendors, using a strong customer service orientation.
Ability to work with competing demands, prioritize and meet deadlines.
Knowledge of hybrid mobile apps development and Cordova is an asset.
Knowledge of current and emerging technologies relating to data warehousing, e-service, quality assurance tools, data retention and document management/imaging.
Experience in the following is an asset: Java, iOS mobile app development, Android mobile app development, OData, SAP Fiori, SAP UI5, SharePoint 2013, Oracle PL/SQL, Software AG WebMethods, web communication, Scrum rapid application development methodology.
Ability to be on call for support of production systems.
Willing to work flexible hours including days, afternoons, nights and weekends, as required.
