Applicants who apply through indeed will not be considered.Hi, our name is House of KibaaWe are a new generation of content creators that are designing for the future. We are merging our expertise in 3D assets and tokenization, blockchain-based NFT tech, and our very own expansive metaverse, Project Origin. We are here to create 3D assets as well as to partner, collaborate, and/or consult with other innovative studios and brands. We are aiming high and want to be the leader for 3D and NFT-based products. We are a diverse global team with an office in Vancouver, and team members around the world. One of our projects at the moment, Genzeroes, is the first live action series powered by NFTs .Hey, we’ve been looking for youHouse of Kibaa (HoK) is looking for an experienced, results driven Front End Developer to design and implement frontend applications for our revolutionary studio. Striving to deliver the very best in next-generation VR, AR & MR experiences. We're looking for someone with experience architecting, writing, testing and shipping production-quality code. You will bring expertise, rigour, and have a refined eye for UX/UI. You enjoy carving out unique and polished user interactions with every project. The chosen candidate will have the responsibility of actively participating with a team focused on constantly delivering high quality code. You are adaptable to meet the constantly changing demands of a Web3/Gaming start-up and resilient to balance multiple projects at once.What we need you to doMake all user interaction with our platform and projects a polished enjoyable experience.Develop frontend systems (brainstorm, experiment design, architect, implement, document, test, and support) that enrich the experience of our users.Build services that interface with the NFT blockchain that extend and evolve our toolsCollaborate with the Back End Developers and other team members to integrate underlying systems with user-facing elementsFollow new and emerging technologiesWhat you have2-5 years experience as a Front End Developer in a professional environment working with one or more of the following:(1)Web applications for distributed systems or blockchain systems, both in their design and practical use( HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and JavaScript libraries).(2)Development and deployment with web services technologies(AWS, GCP, Azure, etc)(3)Relational and non-relational databases (DynamoDB, MongoDB, MySQL or other)(4)Unreal Engine or bespoke game engines on consoles or mobile devicesSpecific experience with React.Has a good eye for design and a solid understanding of user experience principles.Experience supporting and troubleshooting client integrations to ensure client successDemonstrated ability to write clean, portable, reliable, and optimized codePlanning, organizational, and time management skills with the ability to multitask & prioritizeEffective communication skills, written & verbal, with stakeholders of all levels.Computer literacy, including effective working skills with Microsoft Office and Google Workspace.Nice to havesKnowledge of crypto, NFTs, and blockchain is a huge plus. Without this experience, you’ll need to be a quick learner hungry to dive straight in.Experience with Unreal EngineBS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent software engineering adjacent programAn active Github profileWhat to expectHybrid work model out of our office in Vancouver, BC (minimum 2 days in-office).What you get4 weeks paid vacationCompetitive extended health benefits plan10 PTO Days (personal health, family care, and mental health days)Flexible schedulingPreference will be given to candidates local to Vancouver, BC. About You
You have a deep passion for building products and seeing them work well in the real world. You obsess the details, work systematically, build with scalability in mind, and enjoy pushing your technical boundaries. You are driven to own and deliver substantial projects.
You are solution-oriented and can work well in collaboration with a team to define milestones and achieve them together. In the process, you are energized to teach and learn with your teammates.
You care deeply about your impact and are energized when your work improves the quality of life of others. You want to work in an effective team and see tangible results of your work on a weekly basis.
About the Role:

As a Software Engineer with Mobile Dev focus you will be joining us as we launch and expand a new and improved version of our product. We are making product decisions with insights backed by four years of presence in the market with our successful and popular product.
Your activities will primarily be focused on producing, maintaining, and improving the mobile application companion to our core IoT product. As a member of the product team, you will collaborate with engineers and product designers. As an early member of this team, you need to bring a depth of knowledge beyond Mobile Development. Your core Software Engineering competencies will allow you to plan with systems-level thinking and implement your mobile app projects to connect with the supporting infrastructure.
Requirements:
5+ years of professional software development experience, including 3 or more years of iOS development (conceptualization, design, and development), including experience with Swift 5 particularly in audio processing, encoding/decoding applications, and BLE communications
Proficient in Objective-C, Swift, publishing, and maintaining app on AppStore & Testflight.
Knowledge in cloud platforms and tools (GCP, Azure, AWS, S3, EC2, DynamoDB, Redshift)
Proven experience with a companion app development (Hardware connection via BLE & WiFi)
Experience working with microservices and APIs(REST, JSON, and third-party APIs)
Solid understanding of the full mobile development life cycle.
Working knowledge of the general mobile landscape, architectures, trends, emerging technologies, mobile testing, and test cases.
Experience with version control (Github), technical writing, documentation, and relevant tools (Notion, Basecamp, etc)
Experience with Android, Flutter, and React-Native is a big plus.
If you worked here this past month here are some things you would have been involved in:
Meeting with the product team on Monday to plan and prioritize and later getting together with the entire team for the weekly Kick-off.
Refactored an internal data collection app designed and implemented by one of our project partners.
Reviewed and maintained in-house mobile apps that Smart Nora has published.
Released feature updates in one or more of our in-house built mobile apps to support customer requirements.
Participated in Data Ecosystem improvement and automation planning discussions.
Caught up the the team on Wednesday " ️Tea Time" to socialize, celebrate a milestone, play a game, or teach everyone about something you are passionate about.
Joined the team working on the Insights Beta Program - a Data Analytics project where you assist in data wrangling, data science and analytics, data visualization and dashboard creation.
Participated in weekly planning meetings and brainstorms with the team to understand the customer data and business needs to come up with innovative solutions.
Wrapping up the week with the entire team by sharing the accomplishments of the week, watching the latest customer testimonial video together, sharing inspiration, and more.

Salary and Benefits
Remote Work Accommodation
We will ensure you have the right equipment and setup for a functional and healthy work environment.
Health Benefits
We offer health and dental insurance. Our extended benefits package also give you access to an array of services.
Equipment and Tools
All employees have access to the right tools for the job including an Apple computer and software for working efficiently.

Application Review: We will carefully review your responses to our questions and review your work samples.

In a video call we will ask you technical and scenario-based questions to assess your experience on core Software Engineering competencies as well as your expertise on Mobile Development as listed . Come create the technology that helps the world act together
Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.

The team you'll be part of
 The pandemic has highlighted how important telecoms networks are to society. Nokia’s Network Infrastructure group is at the heart of a revolution to bring more and faster network capacity to people worldwide through our ambition, innovation, and technical expertise.
You will join an ambitious and motivated team responsible for creating custom web-based applications to automate network deployment / configuration operations.

What you will learn and contribute to
As a part of our team, you will:
Design and implement features for our web-based applications to help our customers quickly and reliably build up their network infrastructure.
Make informed technology choices and implementation decisions
Continuously improve your personal, and the team’s, skill set.
Work in a semi-agile environment; collaborate with developers, testers, and solution architects.
Your skills and experience
Exposure and interest in full stack software development
Familiarity with Java functional programming, the stream API, etc.
Candidates with past development exposure in Java 8, Spring Framework, JavaScript (jQuery), HTML5, relational DBs are preferred.
Passionate about digging for root cause when issues arise (in both dev and production environments)
Ability to learn in a fast paced, challenging environment, resourceful and flexible
Interested in acquiring / building domain knowledge
Driven to improve both your skills and the projects you touch
Proud of your previous efforts and results
Excellent verbal, written and presentation skills.

What we offer
Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.

Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer
Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.
Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed. Come create the technology that helps the world act together

Worker Sub-Type:
Regular
 Job Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
BlackBerry® – the iconic brand you know and trust – is now a market leading cybersecurity software and services company.
Building upon our gold standard for unified endpoint security (UES) and unified endpoint management (UEM), BlackBerry Cylance Endpoint Security offers the broadest set of security capabilities, management tools and visibility covering people, devices, networks, apps, and automation. Cylance Endpoint Security uses artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning and automation to provide improved cyber threat prevention and remediation, while offering transparency across all endpoints for better management and control.
Among the first to market with full seventh generation AI for cybersecurity, Cylance Endpoint Security helps users understand risks and make intelligent decisions to mitigate them before they happen. Today BlackBerry secures 96% of the threat landscape, preventing more than 165 million cyberattacks in 2021 alone. Named by Cybersecurity Ventures as 1 of the top 150 companies to watch, we securely connect more than 500 million mobile, desktop and IoT endpoint devices for G7 governments, 9/10 global financial institutions as well as the largest global aerospace, defense, healthcare, automotive and media companies. Chances are, we are more a part of your life today than we ever were as a handset company.
Our team:
From BBM Enterprise Secure Messaging to CylanceGATEWAY Cyber Security software, our team at BlackBerry has been building highly innovative products that solve “old” problems in “new” ways, across multiple platforms and in a variety of programming languages and architectures.
We are looking for an enthusiastic professional or new graduate to join a mature team of highly experienced developers who build secure quality software by embracing and improving best practices in architecture, design, implementation, testing and prototyping. The motivated individual will be part of a cohesive team of coordinated engineers open to each other's input and feedback and working together towards a common goal of building world-class Mobile and Desktop software for BlackBerry customers around the world.
Daily work involves designing and programming mobile and desktop software with a strong emphasis on security, privacy, reliability, and performance.
Come join us as we deliver ‘Intelligent Security. Everywhere.’
RESPONSIBILITIES
Application development (focusing on desktop and mobile platforms)
Embedded development
Design, development, testing, integration, and documentation of software.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) with 1-2 years of relevant professional experience or co-op experience, ideally covering design, implementation, and prototyping
Experience with Objective-C / Swift targeting iOS and/or macOS in a professional environment or an open-source project
Experience with Apple back-end services
Experience in API design and implementation (within an application and in client-server RESTful API)
Knowledge of revision control software (ex. Git, SVN, GitHub etc.) and development lifecycle
Experience with test automation tools & frameworks (e.g., Boost)
Experience with software configurations, e.g. (ability to read, write and interpret maintainable code (including process related scripts)
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent tasks
Ability to master new concepts, learn and contribute to the team
Ability to take initiative and work well both individually and as part of a team
Strong communication skills and self-motivation
ADDITIONAL ASSETS
Experience in any of Android Java / Kotlin, C# / .NET is a plus
Experience in TCP/IP Networking as part of application development is a plus
Knowledge of file system, multi-threading, tasks /processes & networking systems is a plus
Knowledge and experience in cryptography is a plus
Knowledge and experience in system/network extensions and filters development a plus

POSITION SUMMARY
BlackBerry® – the iconic brand you know and trust – is now a market leading cybersecurity software and services company.
Building upon our gold standard for unified endpoint security (UES) and unified endpoint management (UEM), BlackBerry Cylance Endpoint Security offers the broadest set of security capabilities, management tools and visibility covering people, devices, networks, apps, and automation. Cylance Endpoint Security uses artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning and automation to provide improved cyber threat prevention and remediation, while offering transparency across all endpoints for better management and control.
Among the first to market with full seventh generation AI for cybersecurity, Cylance Endpoint Security helps users understand risks and make intelligent decisions to mitigate them before they happen. Today BlackBerry secures 96% of the threat landscape, preventing more than 165 million cyberattacks in 2021 alone. Named by Cybersecurity Ventures as 1 of the top 150 companies to watch, we securely connect more than 500 million mobile, desktop and IoT endpoint devices for G7 governments, 9/10 global financial institutions as well as the largest global aerospace, defense, healthcare, automotive and media companies. Chances are, we are more a part of your life today than we ever were as a handset company.
Our team:
From BBM Enterprise Secure Messaging to CylanceGATEWAY Cyber Security software, our team at BlackBerry has been building highly innovative products that solve “old” problems in “new” ways, across multiple platforms and in a variety of programming languages and architectures.
We are looking for an enthusiastic professional or new graduate to join a mature team of highly experienced developers who build secure quality software by embracing and improving best practices in architecture, design, implementation, testing and prototyping. The motivated individual will be part of a cohesive team of coordinated engineers open to each other's input and feedback and working together towards a common goal of building world-class Mobile and Desktop software for BlackBerry customers around the world.
Daily work involves designing and programming mobile and desktop software with a strong emphasis on security, privacy, reliability, and performance.
Come join us as we deliver ‘Intelligent Security. Everywhere.’
RESPONSIBILITIES
Application development (focusing on desktop and mobile platforms)
Embedded development
Design, development, testing, integration, and documentation of software.
SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) with 1-2 years of relevant professional experience or co-op experience, ideally covering design, implementation, and prototyping
Experience with Objective-C / Swift targeting iOS and/or macOS in a professional environment or an open-source project
Experience with Apple back-end services
Experience in API design and implementation (within an application and in client-server RESTful API)
Knowledge of revision control software (ex. Git, SVN, GitHub etc.) and development lifecycle
Experience with test automation tools & frameworks (e.g., Boost)
Experience with software configurations, e.g. (ability to read, write and interpret maintainable code (including process related scripts)
Ability to prioritize and manage multiple concurrent tasks
Ability to master new concepts, learn and contribute to the team
Ability to take initiative and work well both individually and as part of a team
Strong communication skills and self-motivation
ADDITIONAL ASSETS
Experience in any of Android Java / Kotlin, C# / .NET is a plus
Experience in TCP/IP Networking as part of application development is a plus
Knowledge of file system, multi-threading, tasks /processes & networking systems is a plus
Knowledge and experience in cryptography is a plus
Knowledge and experience in system/network extensions and filters development a plus

Position: UI Developer Co-op/Intern
Duration: 4 Months
Date: January to April 2023
Location: Flexible (Virtual or Hybrid)
Come create the technology that helps the world act together
Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work.
The team you’ll be part of
Cloud and Network Services
As Nokia's growth engine, we create value for communication service providers and enterprise customers by leading the transition to cloud-native software and as-a-service delivery models. Our inclusive team of dreamers, doers and disruptors push the limits from impossible to possible.
Education Recommendations
Currently a candidate for Bachelor’s degree or diploma in Computer Science/Technology, Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related field with an accredited school in Canada.
What you will learn and contribute to
Take part in planning sessions
Implement UI components using React as per Visual Specs
Maintain and Debug existing UI components
Document new and existing components
Create test cases for new and existing components

What is Nokia looking for from me
You have:
Experience developing Single Page Applications using React
Solid understanding of JavaScript
Proficiency with HTML5, CSS3, and a good grasp of the DOM

It would be nice if you also had:
Familiarity with mocha, jest, and cypress as a bonus
Previous experience working with UX an asset

Why we’re awesome
Nokia offers flexible and hybrid working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
Company Culture: We believe our people are our greatest asset and we aim to foster a fun, challenging, positive, and inclusive work environment. We offer 1-on-1 mentorship, learning and development opportunities, global impact and interaction, and flexible work/life balance.
Meaningful Work Term: During your co-op term, you will have the opportunity to test out the latest technologies and work on innovative projects that could leave a global impact. You get to use skills learned in the classroom and apply it to real-work situations while gaining professional hands-on experience.
Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer
Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark
LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people.
Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.
See you this Winter 2023!!!
“My experience at Nokia has been amazing, one of the best learning experiences I ever had in my life. As Co-op student, it was an honor to be treated as any other full-time employee at Nokia. I got the freedom to design & implement my ideas. Working at Nokia as a Co-op student was the best thing that ever happened, it was a life changing opportunity.” – Ummar Tantray, Former Nokia Co-op student, Fall 2020

Company Biography: Located on the beautiful homeland that is the traditional territory of the Ojibwe, Potawatomi and Odawa First Nations, for over 50 years, Lambton College has been a ground-breaking institution. Lambton College is a national leader in applied research, teaching methodologies, experiential learning opportunities and future-facing educational innovations. With 13,000+ students from 20 countries around the world, two main campuses in Sarnia, Ontario, and a growing roster of more than 90 diploma, certificate and degree programs, Lambton College offers students flexible learning options with a broad range of programs and courses that incorporate elements of classroom, mobile, hybrid and accelerated educational alternatives.Lambton College ranks #1 in Ontario and #2 in Canada for Research in 2020 in addition to maintaining a ranking within the top 3 Colleges for Research for five straight years.At Lambton College, we’re proud of where we have been, but more importantly, where we are going, together. With Caring and Vitality as two of our core values at Lambton College, you know you’ll be joining a team of passionate and fun colleagues.Specific Accountabilities: Research, identify, and establish new field placement opportunities in consultation with faculty / program coordinators,Maintain relationships and support existing field placement agenciesCoordinate meetings with potential participants and field agency partnersAttend meetings, participate in marketing/recruiting events and promote Community Service programs at Lambton College.Plan, coordinate and facilitate the annual Community Awareness Day for Child Youth Care and Social Service Worker students and potential field placement locations.o Create promo/invites and reach out to all attendees.o Book and get approvals for event details, expenditures and needsTrack data for participants and partnersWorking with the School’s Field and Clinical Coordinator, ensure all field placement information is up to date and available for promoting and setting up new placements (i.e., affiliation agreements).Update and keep current the field placement information for the website / portalAbout the Position: This is a Regular Part Time Support Staff Bargaining Unit Position working 6-8 hours per week, at $30.76/hour. Reporting to the Associate Dean School of Heath, Community Services & Creative Design, this position provides support to faculty for the coordination of field placements across the community service field placements by sourcing and setting up new field placement opportunities. The incumbent also works closely with the School’s Field and Clinical Coordinator in maintaining forms and documents specific to programs’ field placements. In consultation and collaboration with program coordinators, the role also helps to plan and implement the annual Community Awareness Day event.Qualifications: Min 3- year diploma / degree in Community Service program of study (CYCP, SSWK, ECEP)3 years’ experience in the community services sectorClosing Statement: Lambton College is committed to an inclusive, barrier-free selection process. If contacted regarding this competition, please advise the interview coordinator of accommodation measures you may require during our selection process. Information received relating to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.We thank all applicants for their interest and wish to advise that only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.Lambton College hires on the basis of merit and is committed to employment equity. Sunwing Travel Group is the largest vertically integrated travel group in North America and during this unprecedented time, we are continuing to search for top talent. We are looking for candidates who are EPIC (entrepreneurial, passionate, innovative and customer-centric) to join our team and help deliver our purpose “passionate people making vacation dreams come true”.

We want to continue to do our part to help end this pandemic, protect our employees and those vacationing with us, and to support the travel industry’s full recovery. Sunwing requires full vaccination against COVID-19 for our new and existing employees. We will make accommodations for qualifying medical or religious exemptions.

To learn more about our vaccination policy, follow this link: https://bit.ly/2X4TOOk. Also, learn more about our Safe with Sunwing commitment and how Sunwing is keeping its employees and customers safe here: https://bit.ly/3ngVrne
About You:

As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for creating a best-in-class experience across Sunwing Travel Group’s web and mobile portfolio. You will work closely with designers and the development team to translate and integrate UI/UX mock-ups into responsive websites and applications for the Sunwing Travel Group.
You will have a strong commitment to collaborative problem-solving to implement complex design and deliver quality products. As a motivated team player with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, you will be proficient in working with multiple groups and departments across the organization.

What You’ll Do:
Strive to create and maintain clean code and engage in peer code reviews
Identify issues and develop solutions and processes that address and resolve them
Unit and integration testing as per standards and design specifications
Participate in on-going discussions and contribute ideas that speak to project objectives like design, user experience, development, testing solutions, and tools
Manage multiple assignments while working independently or as part of an integrated team
What You’ll Need:
The ideal candidate will have experience in the following:
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React
Experience with Gatsby, SASS or LESS is a plus
Strong experience with using NPM, and Webpack to build and streamline processes
Proven ability to translate approved UI / UX design mock-ups to feature-rich, pixel-perfect websites and web applications
Ability to write clean, modular, high-performance, reusable code/ UI components/libraries
Experience integrating RESTful services and APIs
What You’ll Be A Part Of:
Remote and Hybrid Work Opportunities
Grow your career with challenging and rewarding work that makes a difference
Opportunity to give back through our social responsibility initiatives
Work with a fun, passionate, travel-loving team!
Great travel perks!
Free Parking
Open concept, collaborative workspace
See for yourself! @sunwinglife
We thank all who apply however only those who meet the qualifications will be contacted.

We are also committed to employment equity and to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment. We welcome applications from everyone. We will accommodate all applicants throughout the hiring process. To learn more about our vaccination policy, follow this link: https://bit.ly/2X4TOOk. Also, learn more about our Safe with Sunwing commitment and how Sunwing is keeping its employees and customers safe here: https://bit.ly/3ngVrne
About You:

As a Front-End Developer, you will be responsible for creating a best-in-class experience across Sunwing Travel Group’s web and mobile portfolio. You will work closely with designers and the development team to translate and integrate UI/UX mock-ups into responsive websites and applications for the Sunwing Travel Group.
You will have a strong commitment to collaborative problem-solving to implement complex design and deliver quality products. As a motivated team player with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment, you will be proficient in working with multiple groups and departments across the organization.

What You’ll Do:
Strive to create and maintain clean code and engage in peer code reviews
Identify issues and develop solutions and processes that address and resolve them
Unit and integration testing as per standards and design specifications
Participate in on-going discussions and contribute ideas that speak to project objectives like design, user experience, development, testing solutions, and tools
Manage multiple assignments while working independently or as part of an integrated team
What You’ll Need:
The ideal candidate will have experience in the following:
HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, React
Experience with Gatsby, SASS or LESS is a plus
Strong experience with using NPM, and Webpack to build and streamline processes
Proven ability to translate approved UI / UX design mock-ups to feature-rich, pixel-perfect websites and web applications
Ability to write clean, modular, high-performance, reusable code/ UI components/libraries
Experience integrating RESTful services and APIs
What You’ll Be A Part Of:
Remote and Hybrid Work Opportunities
Grow your career with challenging and rewarding work that makes a difference
Opportunity to give back through our social responsibility initiatives
Work with a fun, passionate, travel-loving team!
Great travel perks!
Free Parking
Open concept, collaborative workspace
See for yourself! @sunwinglife
